Identification_Area.title: Usuda 64-m Radio Telescope (as a DSN Antenna)

Modification_Detail.description: Updated schema version. Adding missing "telescope" references.
Original context file for the 64-m radio telescope at the Deep Space Center near Saku, Nagano, Japan. When used as part of the NASA Deep SPACE Network, NASA assigns Usuda the DSS-48 identifier.

Internal_Reference.comment: This context product provides information about the NASA Deep Space Network as a whole. The Usuda 64-m telescope near Saku, Nagano, Japan has been used occasionally as part of the DSN.

External_Reference.description: An overview of the Usuda Deep Space Center, which is operated by the Institute of Space and Astronautical Science. The overview is contemporary -- that is, ca. 2024.

Telescope.description: The Usuda 64-m Radio Telescope, originally used as a Deep Space Network (DSN) antenna by JAXA in Japan, is a powerful radio dish used for spacecraft communication and deep space research, including radar and radio science.
